Jadi Ketum PSSI, Komjen Iriawan Tak Diwajibkan Mundur dari Polri
05 Nov 2019, 13:17 by Ahmad Bil Wahid
Jakarta - Polri mengatakan Komjen M Iriawan tak wajib mundur dari Kepolisian setelah terpilih sebagai Ketum PSSI. Polri menilai jabatan Ketum PSSI berbeda dengan jabatan di lembaga politik atau pemerintahan.
"Tidak ada (aturan mewajibkan mundur). Itu kembali ke beliau sendiri. Kalau organisasi itu kan adalah bukan organisasi politik, beda kalau menjabat seorang menteri seorang apa namanya, terus ikut kontestasi Pemilu dan sebagainya, harus ada aturan," kata Kadiv Humas Polri Irjen M Iqbal di Mabes Polri, Jalan Trunojoyo, Jakarta Selatan, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Iqbal mengatakan Ketum PSSI dijabat Iriawan sebagai pribadi, bukan anggota Polri. Dia menyebut tak ada campur tangan institusi Polri dalam terpilihnya Iriawan.
"Kan ketum PSSI adalah Muhammad Iriawan bukan polisinya dan itu tidak ada penunjukan dari institusi. Itu adalah hak beliau sendiri. Beliau diminta dan juga mendedikasikan sendiri untuk ikut dalam pemilihan tersebut," ucap dia.
Iriawan atau yang karib disapa Iwan Bule terpilih sebagai Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023. Iriawan terpilih lewat Kongres Luar Biasa (KLB) PSSI di Jakarta pada kemarin siang.
"Kemenangan ini berkat doa Ibu. Ini bukan kemenangan saya, tapi kemenangan insan sepak bola Indonesia," ujar Komjen Iwan Bule kepada wartawan di lokasi KLB PSSI, Sabtu (2/11).

So PSSI Chairman, Komjen Iriawan Is Not Required to Resign from the National Police
05 Nov 2019, 13:17 by Ahmad Bil Wahid
Jakarta - The National Police said Komjen M Iriawan was not obliged to resign from the Police after being elected as Chairman of the PSSI. The National Police considered the PSSI Ketum position to be different from a position in a political or government institution.
"There is no (rule requiring withdraw). It goes back to him himself. If the organization is not a political organization, it is different if serving as a minister what is his name, continue to participate in the election contestation and so on, there must be rules," said the Head of Public Relations of the Indonesian Police Inspector General M Iqbal at Police Headquarters, Jalan Trunojoyo, South Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
Iqbal said that the Chairman of PSSI was held by Iriawan as a person, not a member of the National Police. He said there was no interference from the National Police institution in the election of Iriawan.
"The PSSI chairman is Muhammad Iriawan, not the police and there is no appointment from the institution. It is his own right. He is asked and also dedicates himself to participate in the election," he said.
Iriawan or a close friend called Iwan Bule was elected as General Chair of PSSI for the period 2019-2023. Iriawan was elected through the PSSI Extraordinary Congress (KLB) in Jakarta yesterday afternoon.
"This victory is thanks to your prayers. This is not my victory, but the victory of Indonesian soccer people," said Commissioner General Iwan Bule told reporters at the PSSI KLB location, Saturday (2/11).
